<p><b>Microsoft Research</b> (<b>MSR</b>) is the research division of <a href="/wiki/Microsoft" title="Microsoft">Microsoft</a> created in 1991 for developing various <a href="/wiki/Computer_science" title="Computer science">computer science</a> ideas and integrating them into Microsoft products. It currently employs <a href="/wiki/Turing_Award" title="Turing Award">Turing Award</a> winners <a href="/wiki/C.A.R._Hoare" title="C.A.R. Hoare" class="mw-redirect">C.A.R. Hoare</a>, <a href="/wiki/Butler_Lampson" title="Butler Lampson">Butler Lampson</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Charles_P._Thacker" title="Charles P. Thacker">Charles P. Thacker</a>, <a href="/wiki/Fields_Medal" title="Fields Medal">Fields Medal</a> winner <a href="/wiki/Michael_Freedman" title="Michael Freedman">Michael Freedman</a>, <a href="/wiki/MacArthur_Fellow" title="MacArthur Fellow" class="mw-redirect">MacArthur Fellow</a> <a href="/wiki/Jim_Blinn" title="Jim Blinn">Jim Blinn</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dijkstra_Prize" title="Dijkstra Prize">Dijkstra Prize</a> winner <a href="/wiki/Leslie_Lamport" title="Leslie Lamport">Leslie Lamport</a> and many other highly recognized experts in computer science, physics, and mathematics, including <a href="/wiki/Turing_Award" title="Turing Award">Turing Award</a> winner <a href="/wiki/Jim_Gray_(computer_scientist)" title="Jim Gray (computer scientist)">Jim Gray</a> up until his highly publicized disappearance while sailing, and <a href="/wiki/Lo%C3%A8ve_Prize" title="Lo¨¨ve Prize">Lo¨¨ve Prize</a>, <a href="/wiki/Henri_Poincar%C3%A9_Prize" title="Henri Poincar¨¦ Prize">Henri Poincar¨¦ Prize</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ostrowski_Prize" title="Ostrowski Prize">Ostrowski Prize</a> winner <a href="/wiki/Oded_Schramm" title="Oded Schramm">Oded Schramm</a> until he fell to his death while climbing in the mountains.</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Research_areas">Research areas</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Microsoft_Research&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Research areas">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>Microsoft research is categorized into the following broad areas:<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<ol>
<li>Algorithms and theory</li>
<li>Hardware development</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Human%E2%80%93computer_interaction" title="Human¨Ccomputer interaction">Human¨Ccomputer interaction</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Machine_learning" title="Machine learning">Machine learning</a>, adaptation, and intelligence</li>
<li>Multimedia and graphics</li>
<li>Search, retrieval, and <a href="/wiki/Knowledge_management" title="Knowledge management">knowledge management</a></li>
<li>Security and <a href="/wiki/Cryptography" title="Cryptography">cryptography</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Social_computing" title="Social computing">Social computing</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Software_engineering" title="Software engineering">Software development</a></li>
<li>Systems, architectures, mobility, and networking</li>
<li>Computational and Systems Biology <sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup></li>
</ol>
<p>One of the stated goals of Microsoft Research is to "support long-term computer science research that is not bound by product cycles."<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup> MSR sponsors the <i>Microsoft Research Fellowship</i> for graduate students and the <i>New Faculty Fellowship</i> for new faculty members.</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Laboratories">Laboratories</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Microsoft_Research&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Laboratories">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>There are laboratories around the world in <a href="/wiki/Aachen" title="Aachen">Aachen</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bangalore" title="Bangalore">Bangalore</a>, <a href="/wiki/Beijing" title="Beijing">Beijing</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cairo" title="Cairo">Cairo</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cambridge" title="Cambridge">Cambridge (United Kingdom)</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cambridge,_Massachusetts" title="Cambridge, Massachusetts">Cambridge (Massachusetts)</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mountain_View,_California" title="Mountain View, California">Mountain View</a>, <a href="/wiki/Redmond,_Washington" title="Redmond, Washington">Redmond</a>, <a href="/wiki/San_Francisco,_California" title="San Francisco, California" class="mw-redirect">San Francisco</a> and <a href="/wiki/New_York,_New_York" title="New York, New York" class="mw-redirect">New York City</a>.</p>
<ul>
<li><i>Microsoft Research Redmond</i> was founded on the Microsoft Redmond campus in 1991 working in building 8 by <a href="/wiki/Nathan_Myhrvold" title="Nathan Myhrvold">Nathan Myhrvold</a> and has now moved to their own facility in building 99. It currently has about 350 researchers and is headed by <a href="/wiki/Peter_Lee_(American_Computer_Scientist)" title="Peter Lee (American Computer Scientist)" class="mw-redirect">Peter Lee</a>.</li>
<li><i>Microsoft Research Cambridge</i> was founded in 1997 by <a href="/wiki/Roger_Needham" title="Roger Needham">Roger Needham</a> and now numbers over 100 employees. It maintains close ties to the <a href="/wiki/University_of_Cambridge" title="University of Cambridge">University of Cambridge</a>.</li>
<li><i>Microsoft Research Asia</i> (MSRA) was founded in <a href="/wiki/Beijing" title="Beijing">Beijing</a> in November 1998. <a href="/wiki/Advanced_Technology_Center" title="Advanced Technology Center" class="mw-redirect">Advanced Technology Center</a> was initially a group of MSRA until it became an independent R&amp;D group of Microsoft.</li>
<li><i>Microsoft Research Silicon Valley</i>, located in <a href="/wiki/Mountain_View,_California" title="Mountain View, California">Mountain View, California</a>, was founded in August 2001. In January 2006, the Silicon Valley lab merged with Microsoft's Bay Area Research Center (BARC) in San Francisco.</li>
<li><i>Microsoft Israel Innovation Labs</i> (ILabs), building on its original R&amp;D operation in Israel which was founded in 1991 and tapping into Israel's thriving high-tech community, Microsoft inaugurated in April 2006 the Israel Research &amp; Development Center. The Israel R&amp;D Center is situated in two main locations - in <a href="/wiki/Herzliya" title="Herzliya">Herzliya</a>, heartland of Israel's high tech industry, and in <a href="/wiki/Matam,_Haifa" title="Matam, Haifa">Matam, Haifa</a>, home to many graduates of the <a href="/wiki/Technion" title="Technion" class="mw-redirect">Technion</a>, Israel's leading technology university.<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5"><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><i>Microsoft Research India</i> was established in January 2005 in <a href="/wiki/Bangalore" title="Bangalore">Bangalore</a> and headed by Dr. P. Anandan.</li>
<li><i>Cairo Microsoft Innovation Center</i> (CMIC) was founded in 2006 by Tarek Elabbady and currently headed by Hussein Salama.</li>
<li><i>Microsoft Research New England</i> was established in 2008 in <a href="/wiki/Cambridge,_Massachusetts" title="Cambridge, Massachusetts">Cambridge, Massachusetts</a>, adjacent to the <a href="/wiki/MIT" title="MIT" class="mw-redirect">MIT</a> campus.</li>
<li><i>Microsoft Research New York</i> was established in <a href="/wiki/New_York,_New_York" title="New York, New York" class="mw-redirect">New York, New York</a> on May 3, 2012 with Jennifer Chayes as Managing Director of this location (as well as the New England location). Says David Pennock, Assistant Managing Director, "We'll all be working together in consensus style here in the lab."<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6"><span>[</span>6<span>]</span></a></sup></li>
</ul>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Collaborations">Collaborations</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Microsoft_Research&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Collaborations">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Microsoft Research also collaborates with and jointly operate research centers at the <a href="/wiki/Barcelona_Supercomputing_Center" title="Barcelona Supercomputing Center">Barcelona Supercomputing Center</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7"><span>[</span>7<span>]</span></a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Brown_University" title="Brown University">Brown University</a>, <a href="/wiki/Carnegie_Mellon_University" title="Carnegie Mellon University">Carnegie Mellon University</a>, <a href="/wiki/INRIA" title="INRIA" class="mw-redirect">INRIA</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8"><span>[</span>8<span>]</span></a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Massachusetts_Institute_of_Technology" title="Massachusetts Institute of Technology">Massachusetts Institute of Technology</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/University_of_Trento" title="University of Trento">University of Trento</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9"><span>[</span>9<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-10"><span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-11"><span>[</span>11<span>]</span></a></sup> There are also nine jointly-operated labs in China and Hong Kong.<sup id="cite_ref-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-12"><span>[</span>12<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<p>Microsoft Research also supports research centers at many other universities.</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Research_projects">Research projects</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Microsoft_Research&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: Research projects">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="dablink">For the list of applied research groups from Microsoft Research, see <a href="/wiki/Microsoft_Research_Labs_(disambiguation)" title="Microsoft Research Labs (disambiguation)" class="mw-redirect">Microsoft Research Labs (disambiguation)</a>.</div>
